thread.title: H.S. Boys roundup: Montville, Bacon soccer clinch titles
thread.title_full: H.S. Boys roundup: Montville, Bacon soccer clinch titles

author: The Bulletin
title: H.S. Boys roundup: Montville, Bacon soccer clinch titles
text: KILLINGLY — Eric Ross scored in the 22nd minute to help the Montville boys soccer team clinch the Eastern Connecticut Conference Medium Division title for the fourth time in six seasons with a 1-0 victory over Killingly on Thursday. Nik Strickland earned the shutout for the Indians (11-1-2, 7-0-1) with five saves. Luis Hermoza made five stops for the Redmen (9-6, 3-5). Bacon 3 Fitch 1 GROTON — Colby Decker scored the opening goal and assisted on the go-ahead goal as the Bobcats won their fifth consecutive game to clinch the ECC Large Division title. L.J. Luster scored the game-winner in the 33rd minute for Bacon Academy (12-1-2, 9-1). Tyler Lewis added a goal in the 74th minute. Teddy Lee scored a first-half goal for Fitch (5-9-1, 2-8). Woodstock 1 Ledyard 0 (2 OT) LEDYARD — Jeff Mathieu scored with 1:10 left in double overtime to give the Centaurs the win. Connor Heeda made one stop to earn the shutout for Woodstock Academy (8-7, 4-6 ECC Large). Isiah McNair had four saves for Ledyard (3-12, 1-9). NFA 3 East Lyme 2 NORWICH — Matt Sylvestre scored his second goal in the 61st minute to break a tie and give the Wildcats their third straight victory. Nathan Cherenzia also scored for NFA (8-6, 7-3 ECC Large). East Lyme fell to 11-4 overall, 7-3 in the ECC Large. St. Bernard 2 Wheeler 0 MONTVILLE — Cameron Winearz scored twice to lead the Saints over the Lions. Juan Uran made five stops to earn the shutout for St. Bernard (4-11, 2-8 ECC Small). Alex Haines had 10 saves for Wheeler (1-15, 0-10). Norwich Tech 2 Ellis Tech 1 NORWICH — Josh Ries scored twice in the second half to help the Warriors earn a spot in the Constitution State Conference tournament. Jake Montminy and Evan Socha assisted on Ries’ goals and Ian Hubbert made five saves for Norwich Tech (9-5-1, 7-3 CSC East). Gavin Murphy scored for Ellis Tech (2-10-3, 2-5-3) and Trent Raymond made eight saves. Putnam 3 PUTNAM — Hayden Belliveau scored two goals to power the Clippers. Hunter Touchette added a goal and an assist for Putnam (2-13-1, 2-7-1 CSC East). Grasso Tech dropped to 1-12-1 overall, 0-9-1 in the division. Stonington 2 New London 0 STONINGTON — Chris Tsang scored a pair of goals and Joey Rosa made 10 saves for the Bears (6-8-0, 2-5-0 ECC Medium). Page 2 of 2 - Gabriel Cortorreal made nine saves for the Whalers (5-9, 0-7). Lyman 1 Windham 0 LEBANON — Hunter Hayman put Cooper Clang’s direct kick into the back of the net a little more than seven minutes into the second half to keep the Bulldogs unbeaten in the ECC Small. Andrew Perry made three saves to record his 10th shutout for Lyman (10-3-2, 9-0-1) and Eduardo Garcia made seven stops for the Whippets (7-6-1, 6-3-1). By The Bulletin
